page.title: 19REGENT ARCADE, CHELTENHAM
page.content: Built on the site of The Plough, an old Coaching Inn, the Regent{Arcade } was opened in the Spring of 1985 by HRH The{Princess Anne,}only daughter of Queen Elizabeth 11. CHILD'S VIEW. "It looks very big from the entrance but it is not really that big inside. My dad is an{architect,}he has been working on the plan for eight years. It took three years to build. There are lots of clothes and card shops. There is a very shiny, slippery marble floor. There are mirrors everywhere, even on the umbrella like tops over the seats. There is a glass lift which gives a good view of the Arcade. There is a multi-storey car park with six or seven levels. You are dizzy by the time you get to the level you want. A sign near the entrance shows where the first jet plane was built forty years ago".
